channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The U.S. women's hockey team is dominating the Olympics. Now they will play for gold
item.description: The Americans, whose captain Hilary Knight is leading a generation of thrilling young talent, are undefeated through six games at the Olympics — and they're outscoring their opponents 31 to 1.
item.content:encoded:
The Americans, whose captain Hilary Knight is leading a generation of thrilling young talent, are undefeated through six games at the Olympics — and they're outscoring their opponents 31 to 1.

(Image credit: Alexander Nemenov)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: The U.S. ready to make up, Europe ready to break up in Munich
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio tried to reassure Europe at the Munich Security Conference, but European leaders are skeptical.
item.content:encoded:
Secretary of State Marco Rubio tried to reassure Europe at the Munich Security Conference, but European leaders are skeptical.

(Image credit: Johannes Simon)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: DHS shuts down after a funding lapse. And, why athletes get the 'yips' at the Olympics
item.description: Congress is out on recess as a partial shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is underway. And, why some superstar athletes have been getting the "yips" at the Winter Olympics in Italy.
item.content:encoded:
Congress is out on recess as a partial shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security is underway. And, why some superstar athletes have been getting the "yips" at the Winter Olympics in Italy.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Former FEMA administrator shares how DHS shutdown could affect the disaster agency
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to former FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell about how the Department of Homeland Security shutdown will affect operations at the disaster relief agency.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to former FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell about how the Department of Homeland Security shutdown will affect operations at the disaster relief agency.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Savannah Guthrie issues new plea for her mom's return as police test DNA from glove
item.description: Authorities investigating the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie are testing DNA they hope will point them toward a suspect. The DNA comes from a glove that was found about two miles from Guthrie's house.
item.content:encoded: Authorities investigating the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie are testing DNA they hope will point them toward a suspect. The DNA comes from a glove that was found about two miles from Guthrie's house.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: One Olympic sport doesn't allow women. These Games could determine its future
item.description: Nordic combined is the only Olympic sport that doesn't allow women to compete, despite athletes' efforts to change that. They say their odds for 2030 hinge on people watching men's events this week.
item.content:encoded:
Nordic combined is the only Olympic sport that doesn't allow women to compete, despite athletes' efforts to change that. They say their odds for 2030 hinge on people watching men's events this week.

(Image credit: Barbara Gindl)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Illinois child care providers on edge amid ongoing uncertainty around federal funding
item.description: Illinois is one of five Democrat-led states fighting the Trump administration's freeze on child care funding. Child care providers in the state say they will be forced to close if funding is halted.
item.content:encoded: Illinois is one of five Democrat-led states fighting the Trump administration's freeze on child care funding. Child care providers in the state say they will be forced to close if funding is halted.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Michael Jordan, six-time NBA champion, is now a Daytona 500 winner
item.description: Tyler Reddick won "The Great American Race" on Sunday with a last-lap pass at Daytona International Speedway that sent Jordan into a frantic celebration.
item.content:encoded:
Tyler Reddick won "The Great American Race" on Sunday with a last-lap pass at Daytona International Speedway that sent Jordan into a frantic celebration.

(Image credit: Nigel Cook)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Concerns over autocracy in the U.S. continue to grow
item.description: Is America still a democracy? Scholars tell NPR that after the last year under President Trump, the country has slid closer to autocracy or may already be there.
item.content:encoded:
Is America still a democracy? Scholars tell NPR that after the last year under President Trump, the country has slid closer to autocracy or may already be there.

(Image credit: Apu Gomes)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: FBI: Glove found near the Guthrie home appears to match a suspect's and contains DNA
item.description: The FBI says a glove containing DNA was found about 2 miles from Nancy Guthrie's Arizona home and resembles those worn by a masked person seen in a video at her front door the night she vanished.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI says a glove containing DNA was found about 2 miles from Nancy Guthrie's Arizona home and resembles those worn by a masked person seen in a video at her front door the night she vanished.

(Image credit: Ty O'Neil)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
